programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Trivette infiltrates the gang of a career criminal who is out on parole and back to his old ways, and Alex opens her rehabilitation centre to help steer youngsters away from crime

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: Part one of three. Outflanked, outnumbered and outgunned by the evil Cylon Empire, the surviving remnants of humanity set out on a danger-fraught quest in search of Earth. Sci-fi adventure, starring Lorne Greene, Dirk Benedict, Jane Seymour and Ed Begley Jnr

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Data believes a life-form is emerging when he is introduced to a new invention - mobile computers. Sci-fi drama, starring Patrick Stewart and Brent Spiner

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes (2010)
programme.desc: The renowned detective and his sidekick Dr Watson are on the trail of a criminal and scientific mastermind who seems to control monsters and creations that are beyond belief. Mystery, starring Ben Syder, Gareth David-Lloyd and Dominic Keating

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month

programme.title: Termination Point (2007)
programme.desc: A top secret government experiment into time travel is judged too dangerous to continue, but the scientist in charge refuses to see his work destroyed and goes on the run with the technology. However, as he uses his invention to stay one step ahead of the law, his meddling in history threatens to destroy the world. Sci-fi thriller, starring Jason Priestley and Lou Diamond Phillips

programme.title: Nostradamus (2000)

programme.title: Legend Lowdown

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Kirk beams down to a planet where computers are fighting a bloodless war. On the surface, he meets aliens who tell him the Enterprise has been marked for destruction, and begins a race to stop them making their intentions reality. William Shatner stars

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard leaves the Enterprise to lead Worf and Dr Crusher on an espionage mission to Cardassia, in an effort to prevent war - but the task proves more dangerous than any of them anticipated. Ronny Cox and David Warner guest star

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: Part two of three. The Cylons fatally attack the Twelve Colonies of Humanity and only the Galactica survives. It flees towards Earth but the Cylons want every human dead and follow close behind. Fantasy adventure, starring Lorne Greene and Dirk Benedict

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: An escaped convict goes on a killing spree, seeking revenge against those who put him away. Walker and Trivette race to stop him before he murders the trial judge who sentenced him

programme.title: The One (2001)
programme.desc: An evil genius embarks on a perilous journey through a multitude of parallel universes in a bid to become all-powerful by killing every other version of him. However, he reckons without the intervention of a maverick cop determined to prevent his bid. Futuristic martial arts adventure, with Jet Li in multiple roles alongside Carla Gugino, Jason Statham and Delroy Lindo

programme.title: 30 Days of Night (2007)
programme.desc: A horde of vampires finds the perfect hunting ground - a town in Alaska that remains sunless for a month. The local sheriff heads up a small band of townsfolk as they try to avoid the bloodthirsty invaders and survive until the sun rises once again. Horror, with Josh Hartnett, Danny Huston and Melissa George

programme.title: The Butterfly Room (2012)
programme.desc: A butterfly-obsessed recluse develops a strange, maternal relationship with a younger woman, until a sudden betrayal and her own dark past drive her to secretly commit terrible crimes. A nine-year-old girl suspects something sinister is going on and investigates, leading her into terrible danger. Thriller, starring Barbara Steele and Heather Langenkamp

programme.title: Iron Sky: The Coming Race (2019)
programme.desc: It's 2047 and Earth has been destroyed by nuclear war. The last of mankind, struggling to co-exist on the moon, race to battle an extraordinary enemy and save humanity. It's a conflict involving dinosaurs, near-death experiences and Nazis. Fantasy sequel to cult movie Iron Sky, starring Lara Rossi, Vladimir Burlakov and Kit Dale

Fantasy adventure, starring Michael Hogan and Magda Apanowicz

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: As Captain Kirk searches for survivors on a planet bombarded by deadly solar rays, Spock becomes infected by alien spores that give him human emotions and enable him to fall in love. William Shatner and Leonard Nimoy star

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard leaves the Enterprise to lead Worf and Dr Crusher on an espionage mission to Cardassia, in an effort to prevent war - but the task proves more dangerous than any of them anticipated. Ronny Cox and David Warner guest star

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: Christine (1983)
programme.desc: A demonic car with a distinctly spiteful side and a lonely teenager set out together on a journey of retribution against the boy's enemies, despatching them in an inventively gruesome ways. John Carpenter's horror, based on Stephen King's novel, starring Keith Gordon, John Stockwell and Harry Dean Stanton

programme.title: Don't Hang Up (2016)
programme.desc: An evening of some drunken prank calls becomes a nightmare for a pair of teenagers when a mysterious stranger turns their own game against them - with deadly consequences. Horror, starring Gregg Sulkin, Garrett Clayton and Bella Dayne

programme.title: The Howling (1981)
programme.desc: A TV newswoman left traumatised by an encounter with a serial killer goes to recuperate at an isolated Californian retreat with her husband. However, the holiday takes a nightmarish turn when she discovers the sanctuary is home to a pack of werewolves. Horror, starring Dee Wallace Stone, Patrick Macnee and Kevin McCarthy

programme.title: Knuckleball (2018)
programme.desc: After being dropped off at his grandfather Jacob's isolated farm because his folks have to attend a funeral, 12-year-old Henry is at the centre of a terrifying ordeal. The secretive pensioner dies suddenly in the night, and Henry is targeted by an overly friendly neighbour. Thriller, starring Michael Ironside, Munro Chambers and Luca Villacis

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Crime drama, starring Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Nicholas Farrell

programme.desc: The year is 2019, and the former staff of the Whitbury Newtown Leisure Centre gather to honour Sir Gordon and Lady Brittas at their one-time boss' castle intending to pay tribute to the great man. Chris Barrie stars in this festive instalment of the comedy, from 1994

programme.title: To the Manor Born
programme.desc: Living in reduced circumstances does not blind Audrey to her responsibilities as Christmas approaches at the Grantleigh estate, while a falling out with Richard means the local church is still without a nativity crib. A special festive edition from 1979 of the comedy, starring Penelope Keith, Peter Bowles and Angela Thorne

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo bets Foggy that he will succeed in getting Nora Batty to kiss him before the day is ended. Roy Clarke's long-running comedy, starring Bill Owen and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Young-at-heart trio Compo, Clegg and Foggy gamely volunteer to investigate reports of something sinister stirring in the woods. Rural comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde

programme.title: The 39 Steps (2008)
programme.desc: Rupert Penry-Jones stars in this adaptation of John Buchan's classic novel, set in 1914. Engineer Richard Hannay is bored and restless in London - until he meets Scudder, who claims to be a British spy. When the agent is killed in his flat, Hannay is thrown headlong into adventure, forced to go on the run under suspicion of murder. Fleeing to Scotland, with police and spies on his tail, he teams up with feisty suffragette Victoria Sinclair, and although they fail to hit it off, the couple become increasingly reliant on each other as they race to unmask a traitor and save Great Britain from German invasion. Action thriller, co-starring Eddie Marsan and Lydia Leonard

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra is reunited with an old flame when DCI Larson of the Met's arts and antiques squad asks her to look into the murder of an antiques dealer who was not quite as legitimate as everyone thought. Brian is puzzled by Esther's odd behaviour and her new-found interest in the internet, leading him to think the unthinkable - she must be having an affair. Paul McGann and Jesse Birdsall guest star, with Amanda Redman and Alun Armstrong

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Siobhan's boss introduces her to a new client who, much to her surprise, is the man she shared a secret liaison with two nights before. Although she says it was a one-off, it soon becomes clear he wants more than her professional legal services. Trudi grows suspicious of Richard's spending habits, Katie is confused in matters of the heart and newlywed Jessica looks for affection elsewhere. Orla Brady, Sharon Small, Sarah Parish and Shelley Conn star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the mystery of a missing scientist, after the man's wife receives a series of emails from someone claiming to know what happened to him. The physics professor was last seen in 2004, on a train to Paris for a conference, and when he disappeared he was working on a potentially lucrative cold fusion project that had attracted attention from many large organisations. However, as the detectives dig deeper, a shadowy Whitehall figure warns Sandra's boss Strickland they should drop the case

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Concern grows after a seemingly depressed Tinker goes missing without explanation. Lovejoy eventually tracks him down to his sister's hotel on Burgh Island, which is about to be lost to a property developer. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Serena finds her principles tested when she encounters the dealer who supplied drugs to her dead daughter, and is forced to make a life or death decision. Chloe finally feels ready to move forward in her life, but may have to destroy the hopes of a good friend to do so. Ange and Fletch prepare for their first New Year's Eve together, but Sacha and Dominic's interference could ruin their plans. Guest starring Charlie Condou (formerly Coronation Street's Marcus Dent)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: For the sixth leg of the race, the pairs must brush up on their language skills as the next stop is at the heart of French-speaking Canada, the capital of its largest province, Quebec. To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, including Manchester City v Arsenal at Etihad Stadium and West Ham United v Liverpool at London Stadium. The clash between City and the Gunners was likely to have a major bearing on the destination of the title, while the struggling Hammers looked for three vital points against a Liverpool side that have found results hard to come by away from home. Plus, Nottingham Forest v Brighton & Hove Albion, Chelsea v Brentford, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace, Aston Villa v Fulham and Leeds United v Leicester City

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: It's all about innovation as Gordon invites the food and drink entrepreneurs to Oxford to replicate a sushi platter as demonstrated by a master of the craft. Who will listen and learn? He then asks them to embrace the world of cocktails and seltzers in a can, challenging them to come up with a brand that stands out on supermarket shelves. They launch their products at the world-famous Royal Henley Regatta, where undercover experts report back to Gordon on which ones are proving the most popular

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: The dealers bid on a wooden toy bus, a unicycle, a hand-made model of a mill, a Norwegian pan from the 1970s and a ladder believed to have been used in a French library in the early 20th century. Presented by Nigel Havers

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits a deer farm near Bodmin Moor run by Pip and Matt Smith, before returning to the kitchen in Padstow to make a simple venison Wellington. Later, he spends an afternoon on Porthgwarra beach with the artist Hannah Woodman, whose work is inspired by the sea-worn landscape of West Cornwall, before defining the Cornish sense of humour over a pint with comedian Jonny Cowling

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: At mainland Wales' most northerly point in Flintshire, Derek Brockway's latest walk starts off at the site of the Point of Ayr Colliery at the mouth of the Dee estuary. There, Derek meets John Wiltshire, who is passionate about keeping the memory of the mine alive. Derek lends a hand, helping endangered species in the sand dunes, and little terns who nest on the beach just over the Denbighshire border. Around 10 miles on, in 'Sunny Rhyl', Derek learns to kitesurf and do the surfers' shaka

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Yasmine Akram, Cariad Lloyd, Geoff Norcott and Dennis Taylor test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Former footballer Neil Ruddock checks in and Sharon and Alex want to give him the opportunity to learn more about the local produce, so he goes to Glenarm Castle's estate to see their shorthorn cattle. Armed with a rack of ribs, they create a delicious dinner for the whole B&B team. Knowing Neil might need to brush up on his Northern Irish history, Sharon takes him to Londonderry for a lesson. Famous for its intact 17th-century walls, the city is one of the few in Europe that never saw its fortifications breached

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day 10 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of the final two second-round matches, including Anthony McGill v Jack Lisowski, as the line-up for the quarter-finals is confirmed. Lisowski was the final player to book his place in the last eight in 2022, edging out 2010 champion Neil Robertson 13-12

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie asks the questions as six contestants take to the famous black chair in the final of the quiz. The specialist subjects are British & Irish Lions tours in the 21st century, Princess Margaret, the Rocky films, Bletchley Park during the Second World War, Augustus Caesar, and the BBC sitcom Extras, before the contenders are tested on their general knowledge and the winner is crowned

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The quarter-final stage continues, with two teams who have both won one match and lost another having one last chance to qualify for the semi-finals, with the losing quartet being eliminated. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: University Challenge at 60
programme.desc: Samira Ahmed narrates a look back at the history of the academic quiz, which is the longest-running programme of its kind on British TV, telling the stories behind its most memorable players. Among those featured are Jenny Ryan, Eric Monkman and Gail Trimble, along with Sandya Narayanswami, who helped change the face of the quiz when back in 1975 she became the first Asian woman to take part. The programme also reveals the secrets of two of the current question-setters for the quiz, and Griff Rhys Jones recalls the infamous Young Ones episode where Scumbag College appeared in a spoof of the programme

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: The team helps launch the Wild Britain campaign to protect the UK's wildlife. Ellie Harrison and Hamza Yassin join volunteers transforming an old playing field on the Lincolnshire Fens into a wildlife haven. John Craven heads to Chester Zoo, and Tom Heap looks at the UK's track record for protecting nature, and if a new bill currently going through parliament could undermine it. With special appearances from nature lovers Judi Dench and Deborah Meaden

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: The Fabs were the first all-female group from Wales, brought together inspired by the success of the Beatles. Breaking through in a male-dominated industry was difficult in the 1960s, but Swedish boy band Moonlighters recognised their talents and left a big impression on the girls. Now more than five decades later, members of both bands enjoy a much-anticipated reunion. Plus, ex-addict Simon meets the man who turned his life around and Ellie thanks a teacher who was her rock following a terror attack. Presented by Alex Jones

programme.title: Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: After two miscarriages and three years of trying to have a baby, Sarina and Vik are seeking medical help to conceive while also drawing on their Sikh faith and community. Having always wanted children, the couple are hoping their religion will help them through this emotional time

programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day 11 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where two more quarter-finals get under way, with eight frames in each scheduled to be played. Eventual champion Ronnie O'Sullivan was in fine from at this stage last year, comfortably overcoming Stephen Maguire 13-5 to set up a semi-final meeting with John Higgins

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Yasmine Akram, Cariad Lloyd, Geoff Norcott and Dennis Taylor go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.desc: Richard Blackwood checks in to the retreat and is soon tasked with making chorizo for a French-inspired supper. The B&B's resident chef Alex takes the actor and comedian to meet a local pig farmer with a speciality for charcuterie to help him in his mission. The next day, host Sharon has a special task in mind for her guest. He might be known for his sharp wit, but Sharon wants Richard to sharpen his skills working with a local artisan producer. Can he handle the heat of the blacksmiths forge?

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day 11 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the second sessions of two quarter-finals. Three-time champion Mark Williams was among the winners at this stage last year, claiming a hard-fought 13-11 victory over Mark Selby's second-round conqueror Yan Bingtao

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Five years ago, Gregg Wallace visited a North Yorkshire food factory to find out how they made their popular sausages. Now he is back to learn the secret of the vegan variety, and discovers the process is surprisingly space age. Cherry Healey learns how Canadian soybeans are transformed into protein-packed tofu and historian Ruth Goodman uncovers the green shoots of the vegetarian movement in Britain

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: A visit to Skye from the future King and Queen Consort at the height of the tourist season puts pressure on local police, while a man is reported missing by his work after failing to return after the weekend. programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the audition round of this year's cookery competition. programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The cooks are asked to create a dish inspired by their favourite celebrity chef. The pressure is on as only the best will remain and get to fight for a place in this week's quarter final. With just four places up for grabs, the remaining chefs have to cook a dish with layers to impress judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: The story of the woman who can smell Parkinson's disease. Plus, the world of prescription fraud and an investigation into the science of hydration

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow the progress of a terrace in Worksop, a studio apartment in Bath and a house with several flats in Liverpool

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: Binman Gareth leads the group on a walk around Bala Lake in north west Wales, hoping that the stunning views will help him takes his spot at the top of the table

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Bear the Pomeranian comes in with a broken leg so surgeon Laura fits a tiny metal plate to fix the bones. Colin the basset hound needs a check-up after several bouts of pneumonia and Esme the cat is rushed into the ICU after being brought in for excessive vomiting - and soon the vets are worried about her breathing

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the morning session day 12 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where one quarter-final continues and another concludes

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day 12 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where one quarter-final continues and another concludes. Judd Trump was among the last-eight victors in 2022, prevailing 13-8 against 2015 champion Stuart Bingham, and he eventually finished the tournament as runner-up to Ronnie O'Sullivan

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Yasmine Akram, Cariad Lloyd, Geoff Norcott and Dennis Taylor go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford checks in to the B&B, so Sharon and the team put her to work helping to run the establishment. The broadcaster soon gets stuck in with the day-to-day tasks

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day 12 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the final frames of two quarter-finals. Four-time champion John Higgins prevailed by the narrowest of margins at this stage last year, winning 13-12 against Jack Lisowski

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Banjo Beale and his team travel to Skye to transform a dated cafe and bookshop, and the interior designer takes the bold decision to spend almost all his budget on a set of huge stained-glass windows. Far from home and with tricky logistics, will this job push the team to the limit and will Banjo's ambitious gamble pay off with his clients?

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The search for Wales' Home of the Year 2022 continues in north-west Wales with visits to a dainty barn conversion outside Caernarfon, an imposing Victorian residence in Llandudno and an extended seaside lodge just outside Conwy. The judges are led by presenter Owain Wyn Evans, with interior designer Mandy Watkins and architect Glen Thomas, who score the properties out of 10 on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style

programme.title: The Mysterious Mr Lagerfeld
programme.desc: Award-winning director Michael Waldman goes in search of the real Karl Lagerfeld, who was one of the most flamboyant and recognisable figures in fashion, but also one of the most mysterious. Waldman tracks down those closest to the designer, including his friends, neighbour, lawyer, doctor, bodyguard and Chanel colleagues. He also meets the agent and nanny left in charge of Lagerfeld's cat, Choupette, who he called the love of his life and who earned an estimated three million euros from modelling assignments

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from day 12 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of the quarter-final stage

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Extended highlights of a quarter-final from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, as the players battled it out for a place in the last four

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself interviews the contenders about their performance

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Leeds General Infirmary plastic surgeon Chris West's patients today include 67-year-old Trevor, who needs surgery to remove small bits of tumour left behind from a previous operation. But Trevor suffers from anxiety and the stress of waiting is making his condition worse, so before long he tries to leave. Meanwhile, neurosurgeon Kenan Deniz operates on a tumour growing deep behind a patient's ear, which if not removed could paralyse her face

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Approaching Vietnamese capital Hanoi aboard the Unification Railway, Michael passes the famous street where the locomotive passes within centimetres of the houses either side of the tracks. Checking into its famous Metropole Hotel, he discovers a bunker where guests sheltered from American bombardment during the Vietnam War. At a former Soviet factory that once supplied military uniforms to the North Vietnamese army and Viet Cong, Michael discovers a progressive new manufacturer providing sportswear to the United States Olympic team. He later views the limestone islets and turquoise waters of Ha Long Bay

programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: Documentary about traditional Japanese craftspeople, beginning by following Shiro Kunimitsu and his family as they craft a katana of exceptional sharpness and durability, continuing a tradition begun by their ancestors nearly three centuries ago

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day 10 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of the final two second-round matches, including Anthony McGill v Jack Lisowski, as the line-up for the quarter-finals is confirmed. Lisowski was the final player to book his place in the last eight in 2022, edging out 2010 champion Neil Robertson 13-12, and he will be involved in this session if he won his first-round match

programme.title: Flying Scotsman from the Footplate
programme.desc: A guide to life on the footplate of the nation's favourite steam engine. Cameras are placed aboad locomotive 60103 as it travels along the Severn Valley, cutting through stunning landscapes on a journey from Bridgnorth to Kidderminster. The 'cab cameras' capture veteran driver Roger Norfolk and fireman Ryan Green in action as they talk through the mechanics and challenges of operating this national treasure. Needless to say, things sometimes get hot on the footplate and not everything goes exactly to plan

programme.title: The Flying Scotsman: A Rail Romance
programme.desc: To celebrate its 90th birthday, Barbara Flynn narrates the story of the nation's love affair with the Flying Scotsman - arguably the most famous locomotive in the world, and one that symbolises all that was great about British engineering. In 2004, public donations and grants were used to purchase the train and keep it in Britain, where the National Railway Museum has been working to restore it to its former glory. First shown in 2013

programme.title: Endgame in Ireland
programme.desc: Key players in the Good Friday Agreement relive the all-night negotiations leading up to the treaty, which saw the creation of a unique power-sharing government. However, Tony Blair's compromise on decommissioning failed to overcome local distrust, and once again, the British prime minister faced another Northern Ireland crisis. With contributions from Blair, Bertie Ahern, Bill Clinton and Mo Mowlam

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Approaching Vietnamese capital Hanoi aboard the Unification Railway, Michael passes the famous street where the locomotive passes within centimetres of the houses either side of the tracks. programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: The production of the traditional garment, following the painstaking process of the silk being bound, hand-dyed, woven and finally turned into a kimono by a seamstress

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of the evening session on day 11 at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the second sessions of two quarter-finals. Three-time champion Mark Williams was among the winners at this stage last year, claiming a hard-fought 13-11 victory over Mark Selby's second-round conqueror Yan Bingtao

programme.title: The Crucible: 40 Golden Snooker Years
programme.desc: Steve Davis goes back to the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield to celebrate 40 years of the world snooker championship, talking to some of the players forever ingrained in the sport's history. The venue has become the home of snooker since the championships moved there in 1977, helping to create memorable moments and scenes of drama that live on to this day. Featuring interviews with former champions Stephen Hendry and Dennis Taylor, six-time runner-up and fans' favourite Jimmy White, and celebrity snooker addicts Richard Osman and Stephen Fry

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: The story of two women who fell in love on Christmas Eve, 1944, in the Ravensbrck concentration camp - a relationship that was kept a secret for many years

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Griff Rhys Jones's project nears completion - until he learns there is trouble with the roofs of the mill and the cottage. George travels to one of the last working watermills in Wales to get ideas for the mill's interior

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Early Earth was the canvas for a vast new palette, with the diversity of human skin tones telling the story of how humanity spread and ultimately conquered the planet. Dr Helen Czerski explores the true masters of colour - which are often the smallest and most elusive - travelling to the mountains of Tennessee to witness the colourful mating display of fireflies, and revealing the marine creatures that can change the hue of their skin in order to hide from the world

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Dr Kevin Fong explores the boom in apps and gadgets designed to help people monitor their health around the clock. He meets some of the pioneers of this revolution and visits a man who self-diagnosed a life-threatening disease from his own data, without going to the doctor

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the largest island of the Indonesian archipelago, travelling through rainforests and paddy fields from the capital, Jakarta, to the volcanic region at the heart of Java's Central Province. programme.title: Handmade in Japan
programme.desc: A look at the work of the Hamadas, one of Japan's most famous families of potters, following Tomoo as he creates and fires pots in a wood-fuelled kiln

programme.desc: Colin Murray presents a look back at the final of the 1985 World Snooker Championship between Dennis Taylor and Steve Davis. programme.desc: Its the Big Beanbag Bash Day and Love Monster is very excited to throw some beanbags and win some games. Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny does better than he does, and Love Monster feels jealous of the attention that she gets. He becomes so frustrated that he kicks a beanbag and it hurtles towards the scoreboard, knocking all the points to the ground, ripping the bunting and giving Delivery Duckling, Elder Chick, Elder Panda and the In-Chicks a fright. The crowd is stunned into silence. Love Monster is horrified at what he has done and immediately says sorry. He explains that he wants everyone to cheer for him like they cheer for Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny. She admits it did feel good and tingly inside when everyone was cheering for her, but she says that everyone has something they are good at and Love Monster is the best beatboxer in Fluffytown. programme.desc: Chelsea steps in to support the Brannings. Keanu talks to Zack about Ravi's dodgy dealings, but he warns him that he should not get involved. However, Ravi agrees to give him a trial run by taking in a suspicious delivery the next day

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: For the sixth leg of the race, the pairs must brush up on their language skills as the next stop is at the heart of French-speaking Canada, the capital of its largest province, Quebec. To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, including Manchester City v Arsenal at Etihad Stadium and West Ham United v Liverpool at London Stadium. The clash between City and the Gunners was likely to have a major bearing on the destination of the title, while the struggling Hammers looked for three vital points against a Liverpool side that have found results hard to come by away from home. Plus, Nottingham Forest v Brighton & Hove Albion, Chelsea v Brentford, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace, Aston Villa v Fulham and Leeds United v Leicester City

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: It's all about innovation as Gordon invites the food and drink entrepreneurs to Oxford to replicate a sushi platter as demonstrated by a master of the craft. Who will listen and learn? He then asks them to embrace the world of cocktails and seltzers in a can, challenging them to come up with a brand that stands out on supermarket shelves. They launch their products at the world-famous Royal Henley Regatta, where undercover experts report back to Gordon on which ones are proving the most popular

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton follows the course of the River Ythan in rural Aberdeenshire, through a landscape of fields and haunted castles to a coast rich in wildlife. On the way, Paul learns how to make a haystack, speak the Doric dialect, has a ghostly encounter with a woman in Fyvie Castle, and visits the ruined home of the poet Lord Byron's family

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Mo McIntyre's grand plan to dig up an ancient stash of paramilitary weaponry and trade the arms for drugs gets under way. However, he is unaware that he is already under surveillance and that MI5 are onto him. Tommy Foster's firearms exam is brought forward before he has time to fully prepare. In a bid to convince Grace to come back to the work, Stevie calls round to her house and finally reveals something intimate about his personal life

programme.title: Facelift
programme.desc: Darren McKeown and Tom Cronin get the clinic team together to update them on the hospital, which is behind schedule, while the couple navigate the surrogacy laws between the UK and America. All the staff take a trip to London for their annual Christmas night out, and Darren and Tom shop for presents for Ophelia while there

Ciara faces a difficult decision when she heads to London to see her boyfriend Charlie, he wants her to move in with him, but her career and friends at BPerfect mean the world to her

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: Selby, Costello and Iris all seem to be thriving their new home, until disappointing news disrupts their dreams of a truly conventional family life. As Selby and Costello's relationship begins to sour, cracks in their family unit start to form and their seemingly perfect world begins to deteriorate, with devastating results

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc: Obie takes Aki and Max to his mum's house and learns more than he bargained for. Kate, Jordan and Wendy attempt to conceal Gossip Girl's identity from a determined Mike

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc: Someone from the school's past returns with a proposal for Gossip Girl and a familiar figure blackmails Kate into ruining an important event

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: The team investigates long covid and the scammers cashing in on it with the help of consultant Joanna Herman who suffers from it herself. Plus, an exploration into the dangerous side effects of some common acne medications. Dr Xand examines the latest social media trend in which people tape their mouths closed while asleep to help with breathing, snoring and bad breath

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Chloe and Fergie attend a man who has suffered a suspected stroke, while Liam and Siobhan respond to a concerned mum whose toddler has taken a tumble off a trampoline. In the ambulance control centre, handler Remi takes a surprising call from someone requesting a taxi for a drunk friend

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore properties about to be auctioned, then talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings. A former fisherman's cottage in Broadstairs in Kent is given a stunning transformation and there are dramatic changes in store for property in Forest Gate in south London and Wigan in Greater Manchester

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Raj Bisram help the teams look for items at Ardingly Antiques Fair in West Sussex, while Natasha Raskin Sharp finds out about a collection of early photographs documenting a world tour in 1874

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Imogen worries Rob is seriously unwell and Nina, Scarlett and Zara attend a council meeting about the Beechwalk. Emma helps a wheelchair user who is having problems with potholes

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team comes to the aid of a family of four who are bursting at the seams in their two-bedroom flat in south-west London, with the hallway a particular pinch-point

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple from Northampton find a new home in Norfolk with spectacular views. She also helps a local chef to prepare some seasonal shellfish caught on the coast

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: The dealers are offered to chance to bid on a spy kit, a solid silver fruit bowl, a vintage coffee table, a tribal paddle and an architect's drawing board. Hosted by Nigel Havers

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Rose Matafeo co-host the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By People Before Profit

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Chelsea steps in to support the Brannings. Keanu talks to Zack about Ravi's dodgy dealings, but he warns him that he should not get involved. However, Ravi agrees to give him a trial run by taking in a suspicious delivery the next day

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team welcome Helle and David into the Repair Shop who bring with them a diamond and sapphire engagement ring that has passed down through three generations of David's family. Having been lost for over a year, the couple were lucky to find it on a gravel driveway only to find it was twisted beyond belief and two of the gems had fallen out. They're hoping goldsmith Richard Talman can bring it to it's former glory. Julyan Wallis is tasked with restoring Jimmy Spencer's Hofner guitar that has been in a state of disrepair for decades. Dominic Chinea is tested with the oldest item he has ever worked on: a 200 year-old church weathervane, delivered by Father Lesie Drake from Benfleet in Essex. Finally, Paul Flynn is hoping Suzie Fletcher can restore his leather bait wallet from his summers spent fly fishing with his Uncle Bob in Ireland as a child

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: For the sixth leg of the race, the pairs must brush up on their language skills as the next stop is at the heart of French-speaking Canada, the capital of its largest province, Quebec. To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League fixtures, including Manchester City v Arsenal at Etihad Stadium and West Ham United v Liverpool at London Stadium. The clash between City and the Gunners was likely to have a major bearing on the destination of the title, while the struggling Hammers looked for three vital points against a Liverpool side that have found results hard to come by away from home. Plus, Nottingham Forest v Brighton & Hove Albion, Chelsea v Brentford, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Crystal Palace, Aston Villa v Fulham and Leeds United v Leicester City

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: It's all about innovation as Gordon invites the food and drink entrepreneurs to Oxford to replicate a sushi platter as demonstrated by a master of the craft. Who will listen and learn? He then asks them to embrace the world of cocktails and seltzers in a can, challenging them to come up with a brand that stands out on supermarket shelves. They launch their products at the world-famous Royal Henley Regatta, where undercover experts report back to Gordon on which ones are proving the most popular

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: It's the early autumn of 1924 and Rose's father-in-law Lord Sinderby has rented Brancaster Castle in Northumberland and invited the Crawleys to a grouse-shooting party. However, the Sinderbys' butler Stowell (guest star Alun Armstrong, New Tricks) has an axe to grind and a scandalous secret threatens to derail the holiday. Back at Downton, the servants hold the fort and unlikely later-life romances abound, while Bates takes drastic measures to clear Anna's name as she faces an uncertain future behind bars. The seasons change and another Christmas is enjoyed at the Abbey, where a heartbreaking farewell and a joyful reunion take place. Feature-length festive special, starring Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, James Faulkner, Penny Downie, Joanne Froggatt and Brendan Coyle

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A pregnant woman fears for the safety of her unborn child when a series of ghostly events convinces her the house is haunted. The Craddocks and Boltons fight it out in the Christmas charity dance. Drama, starring Jason Durr, Mark Jordon and Philip Franks

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A visiting American academic delivers a controversial speech, with many audience members worried his ideas could be used to target ethnic minorities. So when he is found hanged the next morning and Dr Hobson quickly discounts suicide, Lewis and Hathaway realise they have many suspects - from the local anti-racism activist who was first in voicing her disgust at the professor's beliefs to the women who had bombarded him with threatening e-mails. But then another body turns up and the case takes on a new dimension. David Soul and Patrick Baladi guest star

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part one of two. An abduction and murder cause professional tension as Tony disagrees with Don's suspicion that the culprit is a paedophile he narrowly failed to convict on a previous occasion. As the killer strikes again, the struggle to find a link between the victims is complicated by Carol's lawyer boyfriend, who puts forward a theory of his own. Psychological thriller, starring Robson Green and Hermione Norris

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A family of five begin searching for their dream home in Italy, and it's panic stations in France as the glampsite hosts prepare for their first guests

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two shows that highlighted the need to get the balance between home and garden just right. In Bury St Edmunds, Lauren Grant believes the opportunity to build on a land she and husband Christian bought from the council will transform their confused downstairs. He, however, just wants rid of the house altogether. Meanwhile, Harrogate couple Carol and Andrew need extra space for Grandad. Can Kirstie build into their sizeable garden or will Phil find somewhere else more suitable?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Cumbrian couple Rob and Ruth, who have bought a 200-year-old former blacking mill and plan to slot in an entirely new, timber-clad structure within its walls, giving the impression that it is peeping out from the original ruins. But the original building is a scheduled monument and Historic England inform them it is too dangerous to repair, giving them no choice but to painstakingly rebuild the ancient mill around their new structure

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents as 22-year-old Ukrainian refugee Mariia enters the studio. Since fleeing the war, the pansexual sex therapist has settled in the UK and is now looking for love with a far-from-average man or woman who can keep up with her in the bedroom. She is followed by 24-year-old Alannah, a content creator from Bristol, who is seeking a forever bloke who can speak the language of love and feels comfortable in his body

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A cheesemaker meets a marketer with an endless line of jokes, and a company director and a fan of motorbikes and rockabilly share their love of the 1950s. Two gym enthusiasts seem to hit it off, but disaster strikes later in the night, while two executives with a taste for sharp suits seem like a good fit

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 69-year-old man is rushed to St George's after collapsing on a tennis court, and the resus team has to work quickly to get his dangerously high heart rate under control. Other patients include a father suffering from shortness of breath and a young man who sustained a head injury playing football. Newly qualified consultant Mehrad recounts what it's like to work under pressure and the satisfaction of saving a patient's life

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarella's in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leone's in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant

programme.title: Keeping Up with the Joneses (2016)

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.desc: Guillermo Galdos follows Brazilian federal police cracking down on illegal mining in protected Indigenous regions and the network of companies dealing in the precious metal. Officially Brazil exports a hundred tons of gold a year. But efforts by police, academics and non-governmental organisations reveal evidence that possibly almost half of Brazil's gold trade comes from an illegal source, raising serious concerns for tech companies using gold in their products

programme.title: The Big Steam Adventure
programme.desc: John Sergeant, Peter Davison and Paul Middleton travel from London to Scotland using only the power of steam. From barges and paddle boats to steam trains and traction engines, the trio use a wide range of steam machines to make their way up the country, and learn about the history and engineering genius of the machines they are travelling on along the way. Peter, John and Paul begin their journey in Greenwich, London, before traveling to Kings Cross station in an open-topped 1909 Stanley Steam car. Finally, they board The Duchess of Sutherland steam train to Stevenage where they view the fascinating vintage planes at the Shuttleworth Museum

programme.title: Inside HMP Frankland: Evil Behind Bars
programme.desc: Documentary exploring life inside HMP Frankland, the men's maximum security prison in County Durham, which has housed some of the country's most notorious criminals, including Peter Sutcliffe, Ian Huntley and Delroy Grant. The programme recounts some of the violent prison attacks that have taken place over the years, including one so horrifying that it forced a staff member to retire. Later, an ex-prisoner shares how he passed the time in Frankland's segregation unit by organising a quiz through the cell windows

programme.desc: Framed for murder by her cheating husband, a newlywed must find a way to absolve herself of a crime she didn't commit. Thriller, starring Brianna Cohen

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: A crown green bowling team in Saydo is determined to end a losing streak, while Joe and Jan receive some devastating news concerning the future of the dog shelter. A Peterborough man who relocated to the Costa Del Sol launches his mobile cocktail bar, and a former racehorse that has been repeatedly rehomed and returned to the rescue centre may finally have found the right owner

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts as The Blood Bikers try their luck against the Eggheads to win the rolling prize fund

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Bean Headz - a team made up of celebrity contestants Isy Suttie, Axel Blake, Geoff Norcott and Harriet Kemsley - take on the Eggheads. Hosted by Jeremy Vine

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Coastal Devon & Cornwall with Michael Portillo
programme.desc: The presenter travels across the two counties in south-west England. His journey begins in North Devon under the shadow of England's highest sea cliff, the 1,000ft-tall Great Hangman, and finishes up on the stunning three-mile golden sands of Woolacombe. Along the way, Michael is joined by Raynor Winn, whose bestselling book The Salt Path is based on her experiences of walking the South West Coast Path with her terminally-ill husband, Moth. She tells of how it changed their lives, and offers tips and advice for Michael's journey ahead, and how he should prepare for the challenges, both physical and emotional

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Truth About Your Ready Meals
programme.desc: Part one of two. Alexis Conran explores the world of ready meals, comparing the many options available in stores and finding out how these convenient meals are produced. In this edition, Alexis asks if home-heated spaghetti bolognese can match the quality of one straight from a local Italian kitchen, before checking out how 'posh' ready meals compare to products from the likes of McCains and Iceland

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: The Cannibal Next Door
programme.desc: The shocking story of one of the world's most notorious cannibals, Armin Meiwes, who found a willing victim online who agreed to be dismembered and eaten for sexual pleasure. Told by those closest to the case, the documentary discusses how the killer and the victim's lives led to their fatal night together

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: It is a big day in the A&E department of Barnsley Hospital as staff are finally allowed to work without masks for the first time since the pandemic hit the UK. For some it's a happy, welcome relief, but others aren't ready to go mask-free just yet

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc: After a driver refuses to confirm his real name, the officers take advantage of new facial recognition technology to determine who he really is

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: CCTV footage captures two off-duty police officers tackling an armed gang raiding a jewellery store. Plus, a drug dealer is caught after bragging about his lifestyle online

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Sinkholes: Buried Underground
programme.desc: Cameras follow some of the people who have seen their houses and lives destroyed by the terrifying phenomenon of sinkholes

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Documentary about vets Julian Norton and Peter Wright and their teams as they administer medical and surgical aid to creatures across the county

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Documentary about vets Julian Norton and Peter Wright and their teams as they administer medical and surgical aid to creatures across the county

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Dan and Nick tail three suspected drug dealers into a car park, but just as they identify themselves as police officers, the trio speed off. Ant and Mark's dogged pursuit of a stolen moped takes them off their patch into the estates of Sheffield, where they play a game of cat and mouse around the backroads and alleyways

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Californian interior designer and estate agent Ann Maurice visits a five-bedroom house on the market in Northwich, Cheshire, and advises the owners on making it more attractive to would-be buyers

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: The piglet and her family visit a new theme park, where there is a lot of fun to be had with vegetables

programme.title: Sign2Win
programme.desc: Deaf game show. Three teams' BSL language and deaf cultural knowledge are put to the test to see who will win 1,000

programme.title: It Should Happen to You (1954)
programme.desc: A publicity-seeking actress with an urge to be famous comes up with a plan to make a name for herself. She rents a billboard in New York with her name and picture on it, and soon becomes an overnight sensation - despite not actually being famous for anything. Meanwhile, a wealthy playboy becomes infatuated with her, to the consternation of her film-maker boyfriend. Comedy, starring Judy Holliday, Peter Lawford and Jack Lemmon in his screen debut

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone (1958)
programme.desc: A drifter rides into a town dominated by the members of a ruthless family. He befriends a Mexican in jail for killing a man who attacked his sister and tries to save him from the gallows, getting caught up in the evil clan's running internal conflicts in the process. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Craig Stevens, Manuel Rojas and Barry Kelley

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared (1959)
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern

programme.title: The Pink Panther (1963)
programme.desc: The world's most inept police detective, Inspector Clouseau, heads off to Switzerland in search of a suave jewel thief who has purloined a priceless diamond from a princess - but the bumbling officer's every ruse to foil the crime ends in chaos, not least when he is framed for the robbery himself. Blake Edwards' comedy, starring Peter Sellers, David Niven, Capucine, Robert Wagner and Claudia Cardinale

programme.title: Ghostbusters (2016)
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occurs in New York City, two experts in the paranormal investigate, joined by a brilliant inventor who has created an array of ghost-hunting gadgets and a public transport worker whose knowledge of the city provides vital clues to the sinister cause of the ghostly activity. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth

programme.title: Air Force One (1997)
programme.desc: The American president is forced to take drastic measures to save his family when their plane is hijacked by Russian terrorists demanding the release of a jailed radical general. Meanwhile, the vice president tries to manage the crisis from Washington and has to decide whether to shoot the aircraft down. Action thriller, starring Harrison Ford, Gary Oldman, Glenn Close, Dean Stockwell and William H Macy

programme.title: Dark River (2017)
programme.desc: After receiving news of her father's death, travelling sheep-shearer Alice tentatively decides to return to the dilapidated family house of her childhood in muddy North Yorkshire for the first time in 15 years, hoping to claim the tenancy to the family farm she believes is rightfully hers. Period drama, starring Ruth Wilson, Mark Stanley and Sean Bean

programme.title: The Whistlers (2019)
programme.desc: Corrupt cop Cristi is determined to track down the drug money that sultry femme fatale Gilda stole with her associate, mattress warehouse owner Zsolt. Writer/director Corneliu Porumboiu's comedy crime thriller, starring Vlad Ivanov and Catrinel Marlon. In Romanian and Spanish

programme.title: Fire Down Below (1957)
programme.desc: Felix and Tony run a tramp steamer together in the West Indies, but their seemingly unshakeable friendship is tossed aside when they both fall in love with the same woman. Tony tries to undermine his rival by exposing his illegal activities, while Felix responds with deadly intent. Romantic drama, with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder (1965)
programme.desc: Four brothers are reunited at their mother's funeral and discover their father was swindled out of his farm and subsequently murdered. However, as they set about avenging his death and reclaiming his land, a crook frames them for killing the sheriff. Western, starring John Wayne, Dean Martin, Earl Holliman, Michael Anderson Jr, James Gregory, George Kennedy and Dennis Hopper

programme.title: City Slickers (1991)
programme.desc: Three middle-aged men take a break from the rat race and their mid-life crises to join a two-week cattle drive from New Mexico to Colorado. Together with a bunch of fellow urbanites, they find the going much tougher than expected, and it is down to a real-life cowboy to whip them into shape. Comedy adventure, starring Billy Crystal, Daniel Stern, Bruno Kirby and Jack Palance, who won an Oscar for his performance as grizzled trail boss Curly

programme.title: Star Trek: The Motion Picture (1979)
programme.desc: A mysterious, planet-sized energy cloud is heading for Earth, destroying everything in its path. Admiral James T Kirk returns to the bridge of the Enterprise to stop the invader, but he has to contend with a bitter rival and the possession of one of his crew by the alien force. Sci-fi adventure, the first movie based on the TV series, starring William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, DeForest Kelley and Persis Khambatta

programme.title: Infinite (2021)
programme.desc: A man who finds himself troubled by memories that are not his and developing skills he never learned is recruited by a mysterious organisation. The members of this group have learned to access the experiences of their past lives, but one has gone rogue, and must be stopped in his efforts to end the cycle of reincarnation by destroying all human life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Locke (2013)
programme.desc: A devoted family man preparing to face the biggest challenge of his career receives a mysterious phone call that leads him to make a fateful decision. However, this act sets in motion a series of events that threaten to destroy his entire life over the course of a single car journey. Thriller, starring Tom Hardy, with the voices of Olivia Colman and Andrew Scott

programme.title: The Fits (2015)
programme.desc: Eleven-year-old Toni becomes entranced with a tight-knit dance team in Cincinnati's West End. Enamoured by the power and confidence of this strong community of girls, she eagerly absorbs routines, masters drills and even pierces her own ears to fit in. A mysterious outbreak of fainting spells plagues the team, and Toni finds herself caught up in danger as her desire for acceptance is twisted. Drama, starring Royalty Hightower and Alexis Neblett

programme.title: Grandma (2015)
programme.desc: A woman recovering from a break-up receives an unexpected visit from her granddaughter, who desperately needs to raise $600 before the end of the day. They visit a series of old contacts in search of a loan, which leads to long-buried secrets coming to light. Comedy drama, starring Lily Tomlin and Julia Garner

programme.title: Arthur's Hallowed Ground (1986)
programme.desc: A cricket groundsman plans to make the perfect pitch, but soon finds himself fighting a losing battle against his home team, who seem hell-bent on starting a turf war. Comedy drama, starring Jimmy Jewel, David Swift, Vas Blackwood and Michael Elphick

programme.title: The Green Man (1956)
programme.desc: A professional assassin and master of disguise is assigned to murder a pompous politician - only to find his efforts hampered by a bumbling vacuum cleaner salesman. Black comedy, starring Alastair Sim, George Cole, Jill Adams and Terry-Thomas

programme.title: The Bedford Incident (1965)
programme.desc: The ruthless captain of a US destroyer develops an obsession with tracking down a Russian submarine. As he drives his men harder, he fails to anticipate the consequences of his actions - leading to a fatal mistake. Cold War thriller, starring Richard Widmark, Sidney Poitier, Martin Balsam, Wally Cox, Eric Portman and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: The Karate Kid Part II (1986)
programme.desc: High-kicking teenager Daniel accompanies his venerable mentor Mr Miyagi when he returns to the Japanese province of Okinawa to visit his dying father. However, an old rival of Miyagi's is waiting for them, while Daniel is drawn into a vicious conflict with their enemy's own karate protege. Martial arts sequel, starring Ralph Macchio, Pat Morita and Yuji Okumoto

programme.title: Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan (1982)
programme.desc: The Enterprise crew faces a bitter battle to the death with an old enemy. Khan, a genetically engineered superhuman tyrant, has escaped exile on a barren planet and hijacked a starship to take his revenge on Admiral Kirk, while also scheming to turn an experimental planet-creating device into a doomsday weapon. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, Ricardo Montalban and Kirstie Alley

programme.title: Deadpool 2 (2018)
programme.desc: The wisecracking anti-hero meets Russell, a gifted youngster pursued by a heavily armed cyborg from the future. With the aid of fellow mutant Domino and five less lucky teammates, they attempt to defeat the villainous Cable. Action comedy, starring Ryan Reynolds, Josh Brolin, Julian Dennison and Zazie Beetz

programme.title: Man on Fire (2004)
programme.desc: A former US government operative battling with an addiction to alcohol is hired as a bodyguard to the nine-year-old daughter of a wealthy businessman in Mexico City. When the girl is abducted, he swears vengeance on those responsible while setting out on a dangerous, revenge-fuelled rescue mission. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell and Dakota Fanning

programme.title: They Live (1988)
programme.desc: A drifter arrives in Los Angeles seeking work, only to discover the city's population is being dominated by aliens who control their victims through subliminal advertising. John Carpenter's satirical sci-fi adventure, starring Roddy Piper, Keith David and Meg Foster

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Maxine is growing suspicious at James' reoccurring mentions of Eric, and Misbah is concerned that the missing food in the house might be Imran relapsing

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Emotions are high when Juliet returns home to surprise her family. Later, James is worried that he might end up losing both Donna-Marie and Juliet

programme.desc: The chef heads to family owned Italian restaurant Giuseppi's in Macomb Township, Michigan. Father and son Joe and Sam Borgia's constant fighting is driving customers away, and Gordon discovers one of the restaurateurs is concealing a serious health problem. Nevertheless, he sets about rescuing them from disaster and turning around the failing business

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly encourages Principal Ball to establish a non-athlete senior night, while Erica's friends are not interested in being pre-wedding fun captain so she asks Geoff's sister

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Penny and Bernadette improvise when Amy doesn't like the tame bachelorette party they have planned for her. Peter MacNicol guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon isn't pleased by the newfound popularity of Stuart's comic book shop when an author puts the place on the map. When Raj attempts to take the credit for Penny's astronomical discovery, friendships are tested. Howard and Bernadette try to arrange a date night

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire finds herself becoming an overbearing mother when she finds out that Alex has a crush on a boy, and Haley's idea of sisterly advice is not helping matters. Comedy, starring Ed O'Neill

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: An earthquake strikes, leaving Claire stuck in the bathroom with a plumber. Meanwhile, the tremor causes Manny to experience an existential crisis, and Mitchell struggles to remain calm. Comedy, guest starring Nathan Lane (The Producers)

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: In a New Girl crossover episode, Peralta runs into Jess Day, who is visiting New York from Los Angeles, and enlists her help on his latest case. Holt looks for ways to improve the team's morale as they come to terms with being on the night shift, while Santiago is filled with curiosity when Diaz starts to take long breaks from her desk. Zooey Deschanel (New Girl) and Matt Walsh (Veep) guest star

programme.desc: An embarrassing secret from Howard's past comes to light as he tries to win back Bernadette, while Sheldon and Raj engage in a battle of wills when they have to work in the same office. Guest starring Katee Sackhoff and George Takei

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is caught between a rock and a hard place when he is made responsible for distributing extra grant money. Bernadette turns the back garden playhouse into a hideaway to escape from her husband and children

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitchell makes a disturbing discovery following an awkward encounter with an old high-school flame, and wonders whether he unknowingly fathered a child in his 'straight' days. programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Naked Attraction

Thirty-two-year-old account manager Kieron from Basingstoke has spent the past three years single to focus on his career, but now he's ready to put finding a partner at the top of his to do list. programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

Gordon's help is urgently needed to get customers back through the door, but the restaurateur does not take kindly to criticism and closes the restaurant down when his employees turn on him

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

Gordon has some harsh criticism about the unhygienic kitchen and the quality of the food being served, but the owner has trouble accepting his advice

programme.title: Modern Family

Comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Jesse Tyler Ferguson

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria inject some competition into their special day, and Cameron grows weary of Mitchell's PA

programme.desc: Sheldon decides to make a new set of friends as he is depressed that the group's social world revolves around Leonard rather than himself. programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Mary Martin and Carl Turner want to build a home that resembles a giant stack of glass cubes in Brixton, south London. The couple are hoping the structure will become an instant landmark, while on the inside they are planning a Zen retreat. But to succeed, their finances must be pushed to their limit, so Carl takes on as many of the specialist jobs as he can to save money. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: Matt visits the heart of Texas to help out a retired couple who run a pecan farm. He then travels north and reaches Fort Worth just in time for the world's oldest rodeo and stock show where farmers from 42 states bring their cows, goats, horses and other livestock with hopes of winning a big prize. Matt then heads back into the countryside as he meets one of the state's newest farmers, along with the donkeys and cattle that are helping him become a social media star

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: When a man is found dead and completely naked after bleeding out from a stab wound to his thigh, Bedfordshire's Major Crime unit charge two women who they believe enticed the man into meeting them with the promise of sex, but instead had the intention of robbing him. CCTV reveals the women were accompanied by two men on the night of the murder. Now with four suspects in custody, investigators need to work out who is behind the 'honey trap' plot and which of their suspects is responsible for the murder

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. Doctors are concerned that nerves and tissue in her leg may have suffered irreparable damage. Meanwhile, a 65-year-old man is treated after falling from a loft ladder, and a mischievous 85-year-old shows signs of severe dehydration

programme.desc: Rick meets his good friend, the actor and comedian Barry Humphries, who fell in love with Cornwall in the 1960s when he escaped London to develop his famous character Dame Edna Everage. Rick also goes fishing for crab, before cooking a simple yet delicious crab omelette. The host then takes a dip in the chilly north Atlantic with an eccentric group of wild water swimmers called the Perranporth Blue Tits

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall

Just off Pentire Point, as the sun sets, Rick rides the gentle swell of the north Atlantic with an old friend, casting his line to hook Britain's fastest fish, before firing up the barbecue to cook his catch with a recipe inspired from a trip to Goa. Rick joins Tim Smit, best known for starting the hugely successful Eden Project, who reveals to Rick his new and ambitious idea in Cornwall

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Beginning in the heart of academia in Oxford, Michael Portillo visits the Bodleian library to see some Victorian treasures, including Mary Shelley's Frankenstein manuscript and a pocket-sized edition of Bradshaw's Companion. At Bicester, he investigates two new rail projects, finds out about Victorian philanthropy in Bedford and finishes in Luton, where he explores the dark arts of the hat-maker

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets off from Oakham in Rutland, where he learns about a noble tradition dating back to the Middle Ages and decides to take part. Heading east to Stamford, Lincolnshire, he discovers why the town is such an attractive location for period dramas, while a ghoulish scene awaits in Peterborough when he visits a Victorian operating theatre where railwaymen were treated. Michael's last stop on his journey is Christ's College at Cambridge University, where he finds out about the student days of Charles Darwin

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with a copy of George Bradshaw's Victorian Railway Guidebook, Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the country to discover how the railways have affected people and communities, and the legacy they have left behind. He begins in Manchester, where he finds out how the world's first industrialised city produced a revolutionary political movement, and learns about the railway workers who founded one of the most successful football clubs of all time. Along the way, the presenter does the washing in Port Sunlight - a model village on the Wirral - and hears stories about the aptly named George Francis Train's time in Birkenhead, Merseyside

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey around north-west England in the elegant resort town of Southport, where the railways provided thousands of holidaymakers with the chance enjoy the fun of the fair. On his journey around some of the region's larger towns, the presenter uncovers the history of Victorian entrepreneurship in Wigan and the beginnings of the Industrial Revolution in Bolton, before heading to smaller Leyland to get behind the wheel of a 100-year-old commercial vehicle
